children.value: Overview
New Items is a feature where you use a base item to create an item with added abilities.
To be clear, it's not the same as item synthesis.

• About
    • Characteristics
    • Pros and Cons
    • Creating New Items
    • Unlocking Secret Pots
    • Purchasing
    • New Items in Dungeons
  • Mechanics
    • Stats and Abilities
  • Popular Items
  • Abilities
    • Weapon
    • Shield
    • Bracelet
    • Grass
    • Scroll
    • Staff
    • Talisman
  • Cheating
About
Characteristics
Weapons and shields can't level up, even if the base item wasn't Lv8.
New Items can't be used as secondary items for sysnthesis.
(Weapons and shields can still be used as a base)
When a New Item is thrown, each of the item's effects will hit the target individually.
(Example: Scroll with 4 effects that aren't Extinction or Exorcism â†’ deal 2 damage four times)
New Items can't be inserted into secret pots.
Pros and Cons
The best way to enjoy both worlds is to create 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.
Pros:
Easily obtain powerful items.
Simplifies tasks like leveling up allies to Lv99.
Warp to the stairs by swinging a staff to quickly dive in dungeons.
(Example: Save time when running Catstones for wishes in Inori Cave)
Cons:
If too strong of an item is created and chosen, the balance of a dungeon can be ruined.
â€» Especially for Old Road and Heavenly Lake, which don't allow carry-in items.
Once registered, New Items can't be erased until you exceed 64 items.
(Oldest registered New Item is deleted when you register a 65th item)
If you're interested in speedrunning, New Items aren't allowed.
Creating New Items
Insert an item into a secret pot located in the basement of Hotel Nekomaneki,
and then wait until the next day for random abilities to get added.
If you like the added abilities, take the item out.
If you don't like the added abilities, leave the item in the pot.
The abilities are added at midnight, and change each day for 7 days.
Once it reaches day 8, the item turns into Weeds.
New Items can be created from weapons, shields, bracelets, grass, staves, scrolls, and talismans.
Other categories like pots, food, arrows, rocks, and torches can't be inserted into secret pots.
New Items are automatically registered when they're taken out of a secret pot,
and up to 64 items can be registered at a time.

Registered items can't be erased, with the exception of the oldest item being erased
when you exceed the 64 item registration limit.
They appear in some dungeons that don't allow carry-in items, so they can be a balance breaker.
Therefore, it's recommended to make 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.
Unlocking Secret Pots
Two secret pots are unlocked after the Ponta (Lot Shop) event for all versions.
The maximum number of secret pots is 6.
PS Vita / Switch / Steam
Clear the main story.
Talk to Ponta and select "Special" to unlock 4 additional secret pots.
DS
Streetpass 5 people to unlock 1 additional secret pot.
Repeat step 1 until all 4 additional secret pots are unlocked.
(It's possible to repeatedly Streetpass the same person)
Purchasing
Talk to Ponkichi near the secret pots to purchase New Items you've registered.
You can only purchase 1 item at a time, and must enter a dungeon to purchase another item.
Staves are always sold with a use count of 4, and talismans are always sold in a set of 2.
The price varies a bit based on the added abilities or effects, but generally uses

the inserted item's value as a base.
Lastly, all New Items have a selling price of 10 Gitan.
New Items in Dungeons
Some dungeons have New Items enabled, meaning you can find New Items within the dungeon.
6 items are randomly selected from your encyclopedia and get added to the item table,
and the New Item is treated as a separate item than the item that was used as a base
when creating the New Item.
The selected New Items can be generated either on the ground, or as merchandise in stores.
New Items seem to have their own item table category, and any item can
appear at any point in the dungeon regardless of the base item's rarity.
(Example: Scout Bracelet or Angel Seed based New Item can appear in Destiny Trail)
As you can imagine, this can break the balance of any dungeon that allows New Items.
Dungeons that have New Items enabled include Old Road, Heavenly Lake, and all dungeons that allow carry-in items.
Mechanics
Stats and Abilities
Popular Items
Abilities
Weapon
Shield
Bracelet
Grass
Scroll
Staff
Talisman

{`Overview`}

{`New Items is a feature where you use a base item to create an item with added abilities.`}
{`To be clear, it's not the same as item synthesis.`}

  • About
    • Characteristics
    • Pros and Cons

{`About`}

{`Characteristics`}

  • {`Weapons and shields can't level up, even if the base item wasn't Lv8.`}
  • {`New Items can't be used as secondary items for sysnthesis.`}
    {`(Weapons and shields can still be used as a base)`}
  • {`When a New Item is thrown, each of the item's effects will hit the target individually.`}
    {`(Example: Scroll with 4 effects that aren't Extinction or Exorcism â†’ deal 2 damage four times)`}
  • {`New Items can't be inserted into secret pots.`}

{`Pros and Cons`}

{`The best way to enjoy both worlds is to create 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.`}

{`Pros:`}

  • {`Easily obtain powerful items.`}
  • {`Simplifies tasks like leveling up allies to Lv99.`}
  • {`Warp to the stairs by swinging a staff to quickly dive in dungeons.`}
    {`(Example: Save time when running Catstones for wishes in Inori Cave)`}

{`Cons:`}

  • {`If too strong of an item is created and chosen, the balance of a dungeon can be ruined.`}
    {`â€» Especially for Old Road and Heavenly Lake, which don't allow carry-in items.`}
  • {`Once registered, New Items can't be erased until you exceed 64 items.`}
    {`(Oldest registered New Item is deleted when you register a 65th item)`}
  • {`If you're interested in speedrunning, New Items aren't allowed.`}

{`Creating New Items`}

{`Insert an item into a secret pot located in the basement of Hotel Nekomaneki,`}
{` and then wait until the next day for random abilities to get added.`}

  • {`If you like the added abilities, take the item out.`}
  • {`If you don't like the added abilities, leave the item in the pot.`}

{`The abilities are added at midnight, and change each day for 7 days.`}
{` Once it reaches day 8, the item turns into Weeds.`}

{`New Items can be created from weapons, shields, bracelets, grass, staves, scrolls, and talismans.`}
{` Other categories like pots, food, arrows, rocks, and torches can't be inserted into secret pots.`}

{`New Items are automatically registered when they're taken out of a secret pot,`}
{`and up to 64 items can be registered at a time.`}

Registered items can't be erased, with the exception of the oldest item being erased
when you exceed the 64 item registration limit.

{`They appear in some dungeons that don't allow carry-in items, so they can be a balance breaker.`}
{` Therefore, it's recommended to make 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.`}

{`Unlocking Secret Pots`}

{`Two secret pots are unlocked after the Ponta (Lot Shop) event for all versions.`}
{`The maximum number of secret pots is 6.`}

{`PS Vita / Switch / Steam`}

  1. {`Clear the main story.`}
  2. {`Talk to Ponta and select "Special" to unlock 4 additional secret pots.`}

{`DS`}

  1. {`Streetpass 5 people to unlock 1 additional secret pot.`}
  2. {`Repeat step 1 until all 4 additional secret pots are unlocked.`}
    {`(It's possible to repeatedly Streetpass the same person)`}

{`Purchasing`}

{`Talk to Ponkichi near the secret pots to purchase New Items you've registered.`}
{` You can only purchase 1 item at a time, and must enter a dungeon to purchase another item.`}

{`Staves are always sold with a use count of 4, and talismans are always sold in a set of 2.`}

{`The price varies a bit based on the added abilities or effects, but generally uses`}
{`the inserted item's value as a base. Lastly, all New Items have a selling price of 10 Gitan.`}

{`New Items in Dungeons`}

{`Some dungeons have New Items enabled, meaning you can find New Items within the dungeon.`}

{`6 items are randomly selected from your encyclopedia and get added to the item table,`}
{`and the New Item is treated as a separate item than the item that was used as a base`}
{`when creating the New Item.`}

{`The selected New Items can be generated either on the ground, or as merchandise in stores.`}

{`New Items seem to have their own item table category, and any item can`}
{`appear at any point in the dungeon regardless of the base item's rarity.`}
{` (Example: Scout Bracelet or Angel Seed based New Item can appear in Destiny Trail)`}

{`As you can imagine, this can break the balance of any dungeon that allows New Items.`}

{`Dungeons that have New Items enabled include Old Road, Heavenly Lake, and all dungeons that allow carry-in items.`}
